creator: Alexander Terp
description:
`matches = [id for _, id, sym in zip(ids, symbols) if sym == ""]`

remembering to have the `_` prefix when you're not interested in the index can be tricky, and it's easy to forget and might catch people off guard. Might need a better syntax.

```
for id, sym in zip(...) loop:
  loop.idx
```

for example? or just make `loop` the index itself (name e.g. `idx` by convention)

Jinja2 apparently kinda does this, we should include a .last and .first bool maybe.
title: RAD-364: rethink for loop index iteration syntax
